subject: Education
title: Self-Assessment: Students as Judges of Their Own Work
description: One-minute skill: Self-Assessment: Students as Judges of Their Own Work.

hook.text: Students who accurately assess their own work perform better than those who can't.

buildup.text: Self-assessment requires students to compare their work against criteria and identify gaps.

discovery.text: When trained to self-assess, students develop internal quality standards that persist beyond school.

twist.text: Without training, self-assessment is wildly inaccurateâ€”low performers overestimate, high performers underestimate.

climax.text: The Dunning-Kruger effect shows why calibrationâ€”comparing self-assessment with external feedbackâ€”is essential.

punchline.text: The goal of assessment is to make the teacher unnecessary.

quiz.question: What is required for self-assessment to be accurate?
options: Explicit training and calibration against external feedback
Students simply need to be honest
Self-assessment is always accurate without training
